content.question: A pump allows water to flow into a pool at the rate of <math alttext="r of t, equals, 2 t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>r</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> liters per minute, where <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the time in minutes since the pump was turned on. Which of the following defines a function that measures the accumulation of water in the pool during the time period from <math alttext="t equals 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> to <math alttext="t equals x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> as the variable <math alttext="x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> moves along the <math alttext="t" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-axis as shown in the figure above?

choices.label: <math alttext="f of x, equals, 1 plus, 2 x" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="f of x, equals, the integral from, 0 to x, of, 2 t, d t" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="f of x, equals, the integral from, 1 to x, of, 2 t, d t" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="f of x, equals, the integral from, 1 to x, of, 2 t, d t" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mrow><msubsup><mrow><mo>∫</mo></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></msubsup><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi></mrow><mo>ⅆ</mo><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

topic.text: 6.4: The Fundamental Theorem of Calculus and Accumulation Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
